Scrambling to make room for inmates

Every prison and jail in Southeastern Mass. is operating over capacity, and correction officials are bracing for an even bigger shortage of beds in the coming years. (Globe)
  • Photos Prisons and jails overcrowded across state

Implant uses the power of thought

The BrainGate, an experimental, pill-sized device that is implanted in the brain, can translate signals from paralyzed patients into control of a robotic arm.

Football, combat trauma similar

The same type of brain damage identified in 14 deceased football players has been pinpointed in the brains of military veterans who endured bomb blasts.

An undercover drug unit will deploy in South Boston starting Saturday, focusing on areas with high drug activity.
